stage.name: Purchased
stage.description: AppGate SDP acquired by NCDIT for statewide Zero Trust network access but not yet operationalized.

MCF.framework: CISA Zero Trust Maturity Model v2.0
MCF.notes: At this stage, NCDIT has procured AppGate SDP with a Traditional maturity level per CISA ZTMM v2.0. Formal processes, roles, and training remain unestablished.

CCF.framework: MITRE ATT&CK (aligned with CISA ZTMM v2.0)
CCF.utilizationDescription: Default configuration only; advanced features remain uncustomized and inactive.
CCF.notes: AppGate SDPâ€™s technical capabilities are present but effectively 'shelfware' until proper integration and training occur.

capabilitiesPlanned.name: Zero Trust Network Access
capabilitiesPlanned.description: Establishes secure, microsegmented, one-to-one session-based access to ensure that only authenticated users can reach specific resources.

capabilitiesPlanned.name: Dynamic Policy Enforcement
capabilitiesPlanned.description: Enforces adaptive, context-based access policies using real-time identity and device posture information.

PCP.objectives: To secure statewide remote access and reduce lateral movement risks by implementing a Zero Trust network access solution that aligns with both NIST SP 800-207 and CISA Zero Trust guidelines.
PCP.notes: The PCP reflects NCDIT's intent to leverage AppGate SDP via established state procurement channels (e.g., GSA IT Schedule 70) to achieve a secure baseline.

PRP.expectedRiskReduction: Approximately 40-50% reduction in lateral movement and unauthorized access incidents.
PRP.assumptions: Assumes timely integration with NCDIT's identity management systems, followed by staff training and process formalization.
PRP.notes: The PRP is based on theoretical risk reduction achieved through AppGate SDP's microsegmentation and adaptive access control, pending full operationalization.

POC.organizationalScope: North Carolina Department of Information Technology (NCDIT)
POC.functionalScope: Secure remote access and Zero Trust network access across state agencies
POC.architectureAssumptions: AppGate SDP is to be deployed on-premises at state data centers with cloud integration for remote access; it will integrate with the NCID identity system and enforce multi-factor authentication.
POC.notes: The POC outlines NCDIT's vision for AppGate SDP as a key component of a statewide Zero Trust strategy.

OI.notes: At the Purchased Stage, minimal operational intelligence is integrated. Plans for threat intel feeds and feedback mechanisms will follow post-deployment.
